page.title: 11A CHANGE IN KIRKCOWAN
page.content: In{1908}the family of Mr Rae,who still lives in the village took over the{ {bakery}in a garage.Four people worked there baking bread,scones and cakes to be delivered to local shops and houses and round the country by van.Flour bought in Glasgow was baked in{Scotch {ovens,}12 feet by 10 feet.Loaves were shaped and greased together before baking.No tins were used.A 4lb loaf,cut into 2 was sold for 3 pence for each piece.When Mr Rae retired in{ {1969}the bakery closed.{Now}local shops buy bread from Ayr,Stranraer and Glasgow.A van makes a delivery about 5.30am each morning.{The local grocer feels that bread baked locally was fresher than that delivered today.
